title: Average test score in mathematics and science vs. GDP per capita
subtitle: Shown on the x-axis are Hanushek and Woessmann's combination of scores from international student achievement tests. The scores are standardized to the PISA test scale, so that the OECD countries have a mean of 500 and a standard deviation of 100. The test scores are here plotted against GDP per capita in 2016, but the test scores are not from a particular year, and instead are the average of all standardized math and science test scores each country participated in.

display.name: Average test score in math and science, primary through end of secondary school

sourceDesc: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank, Hanushek and Woessmann (2012)
